{"blocks":[{"key":"e9o9v","text":"Using the microscope ImageXpress Micro XLS+ (Molecular Devices), check the template for the Corning 3603 plate and the filters for DAPI (nuclei), FITC (gelatin), TxRed (CMPTX) and Cy5 (phalloidin-647).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cqhd8","text":"Set laser intensity to a minimum of 10 ms and increase gradatively if necessary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1ujca","text":"Check the wells using the 4X objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b5s3e","text":"Change into the 20x objective and adjust the laser focus. Select 9 sites per well minimally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e1f40","text":"Acquire the plate. Export metadata for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1a0j","text":"For representative images, change to the 40x objective and adjust the laser focus. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4usm2","text":"Select the sites of interest and acquire. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hmpm","text":"Export image channels and combinations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5udur","text":"On FIJI (ImageJ), import HTD files through BioFormats.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"54mrl","text":"Images should already be scaled. If not, adjust scale based on the objective lens used for acquisition.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b61q9","text":"Set measurements to contain \"Area\", \"Standard Deviation\", \"Shape Descriptor\", \"Mean grey value\", \"Perimeter\" and \"Display label\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cqbl7","text":"Concatenate all stacks into a single hyperstack.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f34rh","text":"Split channels and select the FITC stack for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0km0","text":"Set a threshold to encompass the degradation spots but not the background. Write down the threshold values. Create a new stack with the binary images. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqhii","text":"To measure the degraded area, analyze particles with a range of \"5-Infinity\" and select \"Summarize\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3lftk","text":"Save CSV file. The degraded area (in µm2) per site will be compared between groups in the statistical analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag3s5","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69mhl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"60BA058604454446956F59C9E14496FE","id":0,"step_guid":"6E42CBABC0804F08A5AF5E4D2CCD83FB","title":"and continue until Step #30."}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4gt1p","text":"Split channels and select the DAPI stack for counting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5rrc","text":"Set a threshold to contain nuclei. Create a new stack with the binary images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co9i7","text":"To count cells, analyze particles with a range of \"10-infinity\" and select \"Summarize\". ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9r9l9","text":"Save CSV file. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e50h3","text":"Split channels and select the Cy5 stack for analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag3s5","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69mhl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"gotostep","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"60BA058604454446956F59C9E14496FE","id":0,"step_guid":"6E42CBABC0804F08A5AF5E4D2CCD83FB","title":"and continue until Step #30."}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ek75n","text":"Duplicate the stack as a guide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dm8ic","text":"Set a threshold to encompass cell cytoplasm. Create a new stack with the binary images.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnpid","text":"Save CSV file. The cell circularity index of each cell will be compared between groups in the statistical analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5co7m","text":"To analyze cell morphology, analyze particles with a range of \"10-Infinity\" and check \"Clear Results\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"envt9","text":"Using the duplicated stack as a guide, section cells using the \"pencil\" tool with a 3 px thickness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4oqg3","text":"Merge the Cy5 stack with the TxRed stack to visually differentiate cell types.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"1597r","text":"A novel method to study the tumor microenvironment (TME) in vitro, using the quasi-vivo technology from Kirstall to survey the individual responses in cell types common to the TME. We have developed a strategy that allows a tumoral cell (MDA-MB-231) seeded in gelatin coating, an endothelial cell (HUVEC) seeded in Matrigel coating, and a dermal fibroblast (HDFa) seeded in fibronectin to be cultured in tandem, alongside suspension monocytes (THP-1). The goal was to investigate how cells would behave in this setting and evaluate the role of hypoxic tumoral extracellular vesicles in the development of the TME.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":401,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
